Sequence Information.Peptide Name: RH-16 (Synthetic AMPs, RG-29 fragment, XXA, UCLL1c)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid truncation, reptile cathelicidin fragment, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Cai Y, Wang X, Zhang T, Yan A, Luo L, Li C, Tian G, Wu Z, Wang X, Shen D, Han Y, Zhang Z. 2024
Literature.Title: Rational Design of a Potent Antimicrobial Peptide Based on the Active Region of a Gecko Cathelicidin.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (55.17%) toRG-29K=R: 22%; G: 17%.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC19606 and 3 clinical strains (MIC 4.69-9.38 ug/ml), E. coli ATCC8739 and 3 clinical strains (MIC 4.69-9.38 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa ATCC27853 and 4 clinical strains (MIC 2.34-9.38 ug/ml), and S. aureus ATCC6538 and 7 clinical strains (MIC 2.34-4.69 ug/ml). Warning: Non-standard assay.Structure:  random coil in aqueous solution and helical in 30 mM SDS.In vitro toxicity: showed minimal hemo.lytic till 100 ug/ml and little toxicity to HaCaT and HEK293 cells.In vivo toxicity: 10 mg/kg IV: no observable toxicity within 48 h; mild toxicity at 20 mg/kg.Animal model:mouse: wound skin infection model:S. aureus or A. baumannii: treatment with peptide up to 2 mg/ml led to 84.2% CFU decrease (not as good as colistin at 0.5 mg/ml or vancoumycin at 0.5 mg/ml.
